title: Phase 2: Email/Calendar Integration (Gmail)
description:
## Goal
Enable OpenClaw to read/summarize emails and manage calendar on a Gmail account.

## Prerequisites
- Google Cloud project with Gmail API and Calendar API enabled
- OAuth 2.0 credentials (Desktop app type)
- User's Gmail account to integrate

## Implementation Steps

### 1. Google Cloud Setup
- Create project at console.cloud.google.com
- Enable Gmail API and Google Calendar API
- Create OAuth 2.0 credentials (Desktop application)
- Download credentials JSON

### 2. OpenClaw Configuration
- SSH to EC2: `ssh -i ~/.ssh/clawdbot-key.pem ubuntu@100.72.143.9`
- Add Gmail plugin config to ~/.clawdbot/clawdbot.json
- Set up OAuth token storage

### 3. Gmail Pub/Sub (Real-time notifications)
- Create Pub/Sub topic in Google Cloud
- Grant Gmail publish permissions
- Configure webhook endpoint or polling

### 4. Testing
- Test email read access
- Test calendar read/write
- Verify real-time notifications work

## Key Questions to Ask User
1. Which Google account for Gmail/Calendar?
2. What scopes needed? (read-only vs full access)
3. Should agent be able to send emails or just read?

## References
- OpenClaw docs: https://openclaw.ai/
- Gmail API: https://developers.google.com/gmail/api
- EC2 access: 100.72.143.9 via Tailscale
- SSH key: ~/.ssh/clawdbot-key.pem
